title: Aid Agency Warns of Sudanese Eating Charcoal and Leaves for Survival
summary: The ongoing conflict in Sudan has triggered a severe humanitarian crisis, with aid agencies reporting that civilians are resorting to desperate measures, including consuming charcoal and leaves, to survive.  This dire situation stems from the widespread displacement and lack of access to food and essential resources, as people flee "horrific circumstances" amidst the fighting. While the article does not explicitly name specific key players, it highlights the critical role of aid agencies in warning of the crisis. The context underscores the devastating impact of the war on the Sudanese population's basic survival, emphasizing the urgency of humanitarian assistance.
